basics.name: Aniruddha Ganguly
basics.label: CS PhD Candidate
basics.summary: I am a PhD candidate in Computer Science at Stony Brook University, specializing in Spatial Transcriptomics and Medical Image Analysis using Deep Learning. My research focuses on developing novel algorithms and models that use multi-omics data to facilitate clinical decision-making. I have a strong background in machine learning, and computer vision, and I am passionate about applying these technologies to solve medically relevant problems. I am also an avid musician trained in Indian classical music as a vocalist. In my spare time I enjoy reading high fantasy novels and playing video games. My current reading list mostly consists of Brandon Sanderson's works and Mistborn is my favorite book series. I am a former Dota 2 player (read addict) and have over 9000 hours of playtime (not something I am proud of).

publications.name: MERGE: Multi-faceted Hierarchical Graph-based GNN for Gene Expression Prediction from Whole Slide Histopathology Images
publications.summary: MERGE (Multi-faceted hiErarchical gRaph for Gene Expressions) combines a multi-faceted hierarchical graph construction strategy with graph neural networks (GNN) to improve gene expression predictions from WSIs. By clustering tissue image patches based on both spatial and morphological features, and incorporating intra- and inter-cluster edges, our approach fosters interactions between distant tissue locations during GNN learning. As an additional contribution, we evaluate different data smoothing techniques that are necessary to mitigate artifacts in ST data, often caused by technical imperfections and advocate for adopting gene-aware smoothing methods that are more biologically justified.
